summary:
HRM professional, positive thinker, curious and learning fast with the accurate sense of time and responsibility.
Team player with a creative mind and passionate about continuous developing of HR function and people.

My university degree in English & Cross Cultural Studies (Belarus) and post-bachelor degree in Human Resources Management (Netherlands) together with numerous HR trainings and diverse HR experience of working in fast paced international companies help me to perform well and adapt rapidly in an international environment.

Pets and yoga lover.

certifications.name: Communication with Power and Impact
certifications.authority: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University

company.name: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University

certifications.name: Dutch as the second language, Advanced C1

profile_positions.title: People Consultant Benelux
Employee Experience - HRS Benelux

profile_positions.description:
Areas of responsibility at Velocity Global:

• execute supported employee onboarding, including working with in-country partners and to setup and enroll payroll and benefits
• create, maintain and archive compliant local employment contracts and employment documentation
• ensure supported employees are appropriately set up in all Velocity Global systems 
• research and respond to all benefits, international payroll, expense reporting and all other HR matters 
• responsible for continuously updating the company knowledge base
• support our client service team across all aspects of the business
• drive employee satisfaction and retention, troubleshooting
• communicate with domestic and foreign embassies om immigration matters 
• support and execute upon compliant terminations and offboarding
• develop and maintain competency in the area of international employment
profile_positions.title: Employee Experience - HRS Eastern Europe

profile_positions.description:
Velocity Global is the leading global employment solutions provider that has reinvented the way companies expand overseas. With unparalelled expertise in over 185 countries, Velocity Global delivers best-in-class service and innovative solutions that enable companies to feel confident breaking into new markets. Velocity Global's services include international PEO (Professional Employer Organisation), global immigration, payroll, recruiting and consulting to help companies achieve their global growth goals. Its international PEO solution gets companies into new markets up to 90% faster while reducing the cost of global expansion by up to 60%. Companies trust Velocity Global to ensure a compliant, efficient and flexible global expansion.

https://velocityglobal.com/

Supported countries: Russia, Ukraine, Romania, the Czech Republic, Lithuania, Latvia, Bulgaria, Slovakia, Serbia, Croatia, Belarus

Supported Employees: 60+

Areas of responsibility:

• onboardings of the supported Employees in the context of the National Labour Codes, transfers, offboardings of the Employees in the assigned countries
• cooperation with ICPs (In-Country partners) on day-to-day queries of the supported Employees
• assistance with the travel and expenses policies in accordance with the National Labour Codes
• troubleshooting of the Employees' profiles in the HRIS system
• continuious support of the employees' lifecycle
profile_positions.title: Regional Accounts Associate

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:

- collecting, screening and assessing incoming applications (in OTYS system)
- conducting intakes, telephone interviews
- creating canidates' profiles and candidates' pool (in KIP system)
- selecting and actively approaching most suitable candidates
- administration of contracts, CVs, profiles (in KIP system)
- introducing best matches to the client and consequently filling the vacancies
- VCU/Safety & Health Officer: first point of contact for safety related issues
profile_positions.title: Intercedent (part-time during studies)

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:

- full cycle of recruitment (Sales, Customer Support, Product & Tech, Finance) from creating job descriptions, based on the demands of line managers to onboarding & adaptation
- onboarded new employees (values & behaviours sessions, contract creations, adaptation meetings)
- created exit interview process and implemented it
- trusted representative for the management in all topics related to the personnel
- first point of contact in HR-related issues
- developed and conducted climate surveys
- Workday: fulfillment with relevant data and tracking 
- supervising corporate intranet (employees´ profiles, company news, events; articles about office life)
- legalization of foreign employees/trainees
- payroll administration
- personnel files 
- holidays/business trips coordination and administrative support
- networking with colleagues from abroad (Spain, Mexico, Finland, Morocco, Colombia, Sweden, England)
- HR branding: represented company at local and international HR gatherings, kept warm contact with potential candidates, recruitment agencies, authorities; provided constructive feedback to those, who didn´t meet expectations during interviews


Achievements:

- developed Trello onboarding tool 
- created Screening Pre-Interview questionnaire
- built exit interview strategy in the company
- facilitated in assessment center for candidates /stress-interview/ in cooperation with a consulting company
- conducted retention talks: 1x1 meetings with employees (during the phase of change in the company)
- facilitated in employees' development (surveying, 1x1 consultations with line managers)

Awards:

- Travel Grant awardee (Barcelona, Sep 2017)
- People & Comms Great Job winner 2018 awardee (London, Oct 2018)

Trainings:

- HR Trainstorm (Belarus, Minsk 2017)
- Lead and manage your team through change (Norway, Oslo 2017)
- Performance Management 2019 strategy workshop (Spain, Barcelona, 2018)
- Building team without a bias (UK, London 2018)
profile_positions.title: Human Resources Generalist

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:

- time and expense management for General Manager and Finance Manager
- managed legalisation of the foreign employees (assistance in housing issues, signing the rental contacts, collecting documents for getting multiple visas and temporary residence permit) in cooperation with HR and legal department
- organised all office post (9 locations)
- arranged international travels for whole Heineken Belarus
- managed the efficient and effective spend of the budget for office facilities and taking care of storage of office supplies; maintenance of office furniture; supervising the implementation of new office systems (clock in clock out system)
- supervised the work of secretarial and cleaning staff,  monitoring the workload
- maintained network with assistant of foreign and local companies in and outside Belarus for smoothly setup of meetings for Heineken senior management team
 - represented the company and assisted in sponsorship events 

Achievements:

On top of my regular job I have established relationships with various embassies and made HEINEKEN be presented on places where they were not before.
profile_positions.title: Administrative Manager

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:

 - managed calendar of GM, acted as the first point of contact 
 - organised meetings, appointments, travels of the board of directors
 - took care of the guests in the office
 - received and screened telephone calls and visitors; referring to appropriate staff and/or answering questions, and providing general information regarding established office policies and procedures
 - post management (in- & outcoming mail)
 - Facebook page supervision
 - translations of booklets, brochures (Eng-Rus)
profile_positions.title: Administrative Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:

 - taught English to the pupils at secondary school
 - applied modern teaching methods
 - developed tests and extra language activities in English; 
 - conducting extra-curriculum activities in English (Debates Club, Theatrical performances) 
 - was the supervisor-teacher in 5th class (21 pupil in the class),
 - conducted parents'meetings 

Awards: 

3rd place in city contest among young English teachers (applying communicative techniques and methods)
